item.title: Immigrant Children's Health Improvement Act of 2004

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 668.
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

item.name: Federal aid to child health services

summary.text:
Immigrant Children's Health Improvement Act of 2004 - Amends titles XIX (Medicaid) and XXI (Children's Health Insurance) (SCHIP) of the Social Security Act to grant States the option of covering certain categories of eligible women and child resident aliens under the Medicaid and SCHIP programs.

Amends the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 to provide for an extension of conveyance and passenger customs user fees.

bill.title: Immigrant Children's Health Improvement Act of 2004

item.title: Immigrant Children's Health Improvement Act of 2004
A bill to amend title XIX and XXI of the Social Security Act to provide States with the option to cover certain legal immigrants under the medicaid and State children's health insurance programs.
Immigrant Children's Health Improvement Act of 2004

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 668.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
